text: In the United States, Black Hispanics or Afro-Hispanics, as officially classified by the United States Census Bureau, Office of Management and Budget and U.S. government agencies, are people who are racially black and are from Latin America and/or speak Spanish as their first language. There are Black Hispanics especially from the Cuban American and Puerto Rican American communities. == Related pages == * African Americans == References == Category:Ethnic groups in the United States
title: Black Hispanic and Latino Americans
